title: State Government of Haryana has announced a slew of welfare scheme on the occasion of Golden Jubilee Celebration of formation of Haryana as a separate state. The welfare schemes were announced by the chief Minister Shri manohar Laal Khattar on 1st November in Gurugram (Formerly Gurgaon). Prime Minister Narendra Modi also joined the event and launched schemes like Deen Dayal Jan Awas Yojana himself.
full_text:
State Government of Haryana has announced a slew of welfare scheme on the occasion of Golden Jubilee Celebration of formation of Haryana as a separate state. The welfare schemes were announced by the chief Minister Shri manohar Laal Khattar on 1st November in Gurugram (Formerly Gurgaon). Prime Minister Narendra Modi also joined the event and launched schemes like Deen Dayal Jan Awas Yojana himself.
List of Schemes Announced by Haryana Government
Below is the complete list of welfare schemes which were announced by the state government in 1st November 2016

Monthly Stipend of Rs. 9,000 to unemployed postgraduate youth under the “Saksham” scheme.
7th Pay commission implemented from January 2016.
Deen Dayal Jan Awas Yojana affordable housing scheme launched to create affordable rural housing colonies.
Distribution of free LPG connections to BPL households under “Pradhan Mantri Ujjwala Yojana”.
The state will become “Open Defecation Free” by March 2017. 7 district of the state have already been declared open defecation free.
All kinds of social security pensions and honorariums increased to Rs. 1,600 per month which was to be from January, 2017.
Under Public Distribution Scheme, ration distribution through e-devices.
Decision to make “Ex-Servicemen Welfare Department”.
Financial assistance being given to ex-servicemen, widows of ex-servicemen,  physically disabled ex-servicemen, their orphans etc. increased.
Compensation amount of those who lay down their lives during war increased to Rs. 50 Lakh.
Weekly leave for all police personnel for the first time in the state.
Swarna Jayanti Medals for all police officers/Personnel.
Daily allowance of home guards increased to Rs. 572 per day, equivalent to police constables.
Cycle and umbrella for chowkidars in rural areas.
Financial assistance for destitute children increased to Rs. 700 per month.
Financial assistance for non school going differently-abled children increased to Rs. 1000 per month.
Honorarium of Safai Karamcharis in rural areas increased to Rs. 10000 per month.
All these schemes were announced during the celebration of Haryana Swarna Utsav. The schemes will be effective from 1st November 2016.

title: Automation of Fair Price Shops is a new initiative introduced by the state government of Haryana under which the state government would install automation systems in the fair price shops.

हरियाणा सरकार ने छोटे व्यापारियों और दुकानदारों के लिए मुख्यमंत्री व्यापारी क्षतिपूर्ति बीमा योजना और मुख्यमंत्री व्यापारी सामूहिक निजी दुर्घटना बीमा योजना की शुरुआत करी, जानिये क्या हैं इसके लाभ और पाएं पूरी जानकारीHaryana government has started Mukhyamantri Vyapari Kshatipurti Beema Yojana 2019. Under this scheme, govt. will provide an insurance cover ranging from Rs. 5 lakh to Rs. 25 lakh as per their stock / turnover. This coverage would be applicable to all registered small and medium traders, shopkeepers, self employed persons. CM Manohar Lal Khattar has also started Mukhyamantri Vyapari Samuhik Niji Durghatna Bima Yojana to provide Rs. 5 lakh insurance to traders.
full_text:
हरियाणा सरकार ने छोटे व्यापारियों और दुकानदारों के लिए मुख्यमंत्री व्यापारी क्षतिपूर्ति बीमा योजना और मुख्यमंत्री व्यापारी सामूहिक निजी दुर्घटना बीमा योजना की शुरुआत करी, जानिये क्या हैं इसके लाभ और पाएं पूरी जानकारीHaryana government has started Mukhyamantri Vyapari Kshatipurti Beema Yojana 2019. Under this scheme, govt. will provide an insurance cover ranging from Rs. 5 lakh to Rs. 25 lakh as per their stock / turnover. This coverage would be applicable to all registered small and medium traders, shopkeepers, self employed persons. CM Manohar Lal Khattar has also started Mukhyamantri Vyapari Samuhik Niji Durghatna Bima Yojana to provide Rs. 5 lakh insurance to traders.
The total premium of Rs. 38 crore for both Mukhyamantri Vyapari Samuhik Niji Durghatna Bima Yojana & Mukhyamantri Vyapari Kshatipurti Beema Yojana would be borne by the Haryana government. On this occasion, CM has also presented insurance certificates to six beneficiaries under this scheme.
CM has also made several other announcements for the welfare of different sections of society.



(adsbygoogle=window.adsbygoogle||[]).push({});

Haryana Mukhyamantri Vyapari Kshatipurti Bima Yojana
The important features and highlights of this scheme are as follows:-


Haryana CM Vyapari Kshatipurti Bima Yojna


Launch Date
11 September 2019


Who are its Beneficiaries
All registered small and medium traders, retailers, shopkeepers & self employed persons


Number of Beneficiaries
3.13 lakh


Cases for Applicability
Govt. will compensate loss of trader’s stock caused due to fire, theft, flood and earthquake and damage to furniture and other goods


Amount of Insurance
Rs. 5 Lakh to Rs. 25 Lakh


Turnover Limit
Rs. 5 lakh insurance for annual turnover upto Rs. 20 lakh, Rs. 10 lakh insurance coverage for turnover b/w Rs. 20 lakh to Rs. 50 lakh, Rs. 15 lakh insurance cover for turnover b/w Rs. 50 lakh to Rs. 1 crore, Insurance cover of Rs. 20 lakh for turnover b/w Rs. 1 crore to Rs. 1.5 crore, Rs. 25 lakh for traders having turnover of more than Rs. 1.5 crore.


An insurance cover of Rs. 5 lakh to Rs. 25 lakh would be provided to registered traders on the basis of their turnover. 


(adsbygoogle=window.adsbygoogle||[]).push({});

The loss of stock due to any of the above mentioned reasons would attract compensation from the Haryana govt. Around 3.13 lakh registered small and medium traders would be benefited under this scheme.

Under the Deen Dayal Jan Awas Yojana, the state government aims to develop about 1 Lakh affordable homes in next three years.

State Government of Haryana has approved a new taxi scheme for improving public transport in 13 districts falling in National Capital Region. The scheme was proposed by the State Transport Department to run radio cabs in districts in the state falling in NCR.
full_text:
State Government of Haryana has approved a new taxi scheme for improving public transport in 13 districts falling in National Capital Region. The scheme was proposed by the State Transport Department to run radio cabs in districts in the state falling in NCR.
The thirteen districts where the scheme will be implemented are Gurgaon, Faridabad, Jhajjar, Rohtak, Bhiwani, Sonepat, Panipat, Karnal, Mewa, Palwal, Rewari, Jind and Mahendragarh. The licenses to operate radio taxi under the scheme would be granted under sections 74 and 76 of the Motor Vehicles Act, 1988.
The license to operate can be granted to individuals, firms, societies or companies including IT based aggregator registered under Haryana Societies Registration Act 2012.



(adsbygoogle=window.adsbygoogle||[]).push({});

Each taxi running under the NCR Taxi Scheme 2016 would be equipped with GPS or GPRS device to track its location. The device will remain connected to the control room to share the hire status.
The scheme will also ensure the safety of women using the taxi service. Women helpline number 1091 and police helpline number 1073 shall be prominently displayed inside and outside the taxi. No tinted glass or curtains or films shall be affixed on the taxi.


(adsbygoogle=window.adsbygoogle||[]).push({});

Taxi under NCR Taxi Scheme 2016
Every taxi running under NCR taxi scheme 2016 will bear an engine capacity of at least 600CC with seating capacity for no more than 6 persons. The taxi will be powered by Compressed Natural Gas or Liquified Petroleum Gas or would be battery operated. Open type or non-hard top vehicles will not be allowed. The taxi should meet the emission standard and checkups should be done time to time as defined by the transport department.
The color of the taxi shall be white with a blue colored strip on both sides of the taxi displaying the name of the licensee. The driver of the taxi should be at least middle school pass or equivalent having a valid commercial or transport driving license.

title: Pashudhan Bima Yojana is a new insurance scheme launched by the Government of Haryana on Friday. Under the scheme, state government will provide insurance cover to cows, buffaloes, bulls, camel, sheep, goat and pig for a period for three years.
full_text:
Pashudhan Bima Yojana is a new insurance scheme launched by the Government of Haryana on Friday. Under the scheme, state government will provide insurance cover to cows, buffaloes, bulls, camel, sheep, goat and pig for a period for three years. 
Pashudhan Bima Yojana was launched at a function in Jhajjar by OP Dhankar, State Animal Husbandry and Dairying Minister. During the function, cattle breeders were also provided the scheme document and urged them to take maximum benefits from the scheme.
Premium of Pashudhan Bima Yojana
Under the Pashudhan Bima Yojana, different premium will be charged fro different animals. The insurance cover would be provided for three years. The premium under the Pashudhan Bima Yojana will be 



(adsbygoogle=window.adsbygoogle||[]).push({});

Cows, Buffaloes, Bulls, Camel – Rs. 100
Sheep, Goat, Pig – Rs. 25
The scheme is free of cost for cattle breeders belonging to Scheduled Castes.


(adsbygoogle=window.adsbygoogle||[]).push({});

Under the scheme, the insurance companies will pay the compensation in case of death of the animal. 
Animal Husbandry and Dairying Department of Haryana Government is planning to cover one lakh cattle under Pashudhan Bima Yojana.

title: Haryana Government is inviting applications for grant of license from colonizers/builders/developers under the Deen Dayal Jana Awas Yojana affordable plotted housing policy – 2016. The applications can be made to the implementing agency, Town and Country Planning, Haryana by 30th June 2016.
full_text:
Haryana Government is inviting applications for grant of license from colonizers/builders/developers under the Deen Dayal Jana Awas Yojana affordable plotted housing policy – 2016. The applications can be made to the implementing agency, Town and Country Planning, Haryana by 30th June 2016.
Affordable Plotted Housing Policy 2016 for low & medium potential towns was released by the state Government in February this year. Under the Deen Dayal Jan Awas Yojana, the state government aims to provide affordable residential housing units to one lakh citizens in the state.
Interested real estate builders or developers can apply for the grant of license for construction of homes under this policy. The scheme is applicable in all cities and towns of the state except Sohna, Gwalpahari, Gurugram, Faridabad, Sonipat, Panipat and Panchkula periphery.



(adsbygoogle=window.adsbygoogle||[]).push({});

The state government is promoting the policy with the tagline “Apna Awas – Sukhad Awas” for the end consumers. The actual housing unit buyers and developers are given many financial benefits under the scheme to make it truly affordable such as:

License fee and EDC charges are minimised.
No land usage conversion charges.
No IDC

The scheme was launched on 1st April and the last date for submission of applications for grant of license is 30th June. Below is the advertisement published by the TCP Harayan.


(adsbygoogle=window.adsbygoogle||[]).push({});

Deen Dayal Jan Awas Yojana – Affordable Plotted Housing Policy – 2016
More details about the scheme can be obtained from the official website of TCP haryana at www.tcpharyana.gov.in

title: Haryana Government has notified Affordable Plotted Housing Policy 2016 for Low and Medium Potential Towns, the policy will be named as Deen Dayal Jan Awas Yojana. This policy is intended to encourage the development of high density plotted colonies in Low and Medium Potential towns of the State wherein small plots are made available through a liberal policy framework.
full_text:
Haryana Government has notified Affordable Plotted Housing Policy 2016 for Low and Medium Potential Towns, the policy will be named as Deen Dayal Jan Awas Yojana. This policy is intended to encourage the development of high density plotted colonies in Low and Medium Potential towns of the State wherein small plots are made available through a liberal policy framework.
Features of Deen Dayal Jan Awas Yojana or Affordable Plotted Housing Policy 2016

Under the Deen Dayal Jan Awas Yojana, all the projects are required to be completed within 7 years from the date of approval of license.
In any residential sector not more than 30% of the net planned area under residential zone, inclusive of the 20% area limit allowed for group housing projects, can be allowed for projects under this policy. However, if a residential sector has an area of less than 50 acres, one such project shall be allowed upto 15 acres.
65% of the licensed area is the maximum allowed area under residential and commercial plots.
The minimum and maximum net planned area for such projects shall be 5 acres and 15 acres respectively irrespective of the Development Plan where such project is proposed. Not more than 10% of the licensed area should fall under sector roads.
Area under commercial use should not exceed 4% of the licensed area.
Minimum width of the roads in the colony should be 9 meters.
The first licence may be obtained for an area of 5 acres or more and additional license for minimum 2 acres can be obtained to take the aggregated area of colony upto 15 acres.
Minimum 7.5% of the licensed area should be kept as organized open space.
Registration of independent floors in plots shall be allowed.
Clubbing of residential plots for approval of integrated zoning plan of two adjoining plots under same ownership shall not be permitted in the colonies approved under the present policy.
Grant of licence shall be considered under this policy, initially, against 20% group housing area limit in such sector. Once the area under 20% limit stands exhausted on account of either group housing licences or affordable housing policy 2013 projects or under the present policy; grant of any further license under this policy shall be considered only upto a further limit of 10% of the net planned area under residential zone of such sector.

Under the Deen Dayal Jan Awas Yojana, max allowed area of the plot would be 150 Sq.Mt.. The minimum and maximum density per acre is 240 and 400 people respectively.
The detailed document of Deen Dayal Jan Awas Yojana can be found here.

title: Haryana Government has approved the implementation of Deen Dayal Jan Awas Yojana under which the private developers will develop 1 Lakh housing units in the coming years in the state. The government aims to provide homes at the arte of Rs 1521 per square foot in cities like Panchkula.
full_text:
Haryana Government has approved the implementation of Deen Dayal Jan Awas Yojana under which the private developers will develop 1 Lakh housing units in the coming years in the state. The government aims to provide homes at the arte of Rs 1521 per square foot in cities like Panchkula.
Deen Dayal Jan Awas Yojana aims to develop low cost and high density housing colonies in low and medium potential towns where the and may be available for the development. The scheme has been approved under the Consolidated Licensing Policy 2015 of Haryana Government.
LATEST UPDATE: Application Invited for Grant of License



(adsbygoogle=window.adsbygoogle||[]).push({});

The flats under the Deen Dayal Jan Awas Yojana will be constructed by the private housing construction firms under the supervision of state government. The scheme will also help reduce the increase in unauthorized colonies in the state. 
Under the Deen Dayal Jan Awas Yojana, all the developers will have to complete the housing projects within 7 years after the grant of the license. The developers will be allowed to develop the housing units only in the residential zones of the towns as specified in the respective master development plans.


(adsbygoogle=window.adsbygoogle||[]).push({});

Under the scheme, the license fee for the medium-potential towns will be levied at a rate of Rs 1 lakh per acre and for Rs 10,000 per acre for low-potential towns.
Features of Deen Dayal Jan Awas Yojana

Builders or the land owners can build housing society or colony in 2 acre to 10 acres of land.
Government will not acquire land for the builders, but the builders have to purchase the land themselves.
Land owners will have the freedom to sell their land at the market rate.
The CLU will be approved within 90 days after the application.
Farmers will also be allowed to develop housing units on their land.
Builders will be allowed to develop colonies in 25 acres of area instead of previous minimum of 100 acres.
2 Lakh homes will be constructed in the state under the scheme by the year 2022.

More details about the Deen Dayal Jan Awas Yojana can be found at the link below
https://sarkariyojana.com/affordable-plotted-housing-policy-2016-deen-dayal-jan-awas-yojana/
OR you can download the official policy document from the website of TCP Haryana at www.tcpharyana.gov.in

full_text:
प्रधानमंत्री आवास योजना 2019-2020 ऑनलाइन पंजीकरण और आवेदन प्रधामंत्री आवास योजना की आधिकारिक वेबसाइट pmaymis.gov.in पर उपलब्ध हैं। जानें प्रधानमंत्री आवास योजना के फायदे, पात्रता और अन्य जानकारी

Table of Contents

PM Awas Yojana Online Application Forms 2020PMAY EligibilityTake Printout of Online Application Form of PMAYPMAY Online Application Edit/Change/Update
pmaymis.gov.in – PMAY Online Application Forms 2020 | PMAY Online Registration CSC | Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana Online Application Form 2020
Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana 2020 online application forms are being accepted through the official website of PM Awas Yojana at pmaymis.gov.in. The online application process for Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana is very simple and here we will guide you on how to fill online application forms for Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana 2019-2020 through pmaymis.gov.in.
The online registration process for PM Awas Yojana is very simple, you just need to make sure that you are entering the correct information. If you are eligible to apply for PMAY, you can follow the below step by step PMAY online application procedure along with screenshots.



(adsbygoogle=window.adsbygoogle||[]).push({});

LATEST UPDATE: Online applications for the PM Awas Yojana have been started again after the general elections 2019. Below is the complete procedure to apply online for PMAY-U.
The central government has recently extended the timeline to avail the interest subsidy on home loans under CLSS component of Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana – Urban by 15 Months. However the PMAY Last Date has been extended for the MIG applicants only.


(adsbygoogle=window.adsbygoogle||[]).push({});

PM Awas Yojana Online Application Forms 2020
Below is the complete step by step procedure to apply online for Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana – Urban through the official website.
STEP 1: Open the official website of PMAY at pmaymis.gov.in and select one of the two options of Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana application from “Citizen Assessment” menu, as given in the below screenshot.
PMAY HFA Urban Online Registration
You have to select one of the two links as per the following criteria
– If you are currently living in slum area, then select “For Slum Dwellers” otherwise select “Benefits under other 3 Components” from the drop down menu.
OR You can directly click the following links to apply online for PMAY
For Slum Dwellers: https://pmaymis.gov.in/Open/Check_Aadhar_Existence.aspx?comp=a
For benefits under other 3 Components: https://pmaymis.gov.in/Open/Check_Aadhar_Existence.aspx?comp=b
STEP 2: On the next page as seen below, you will have to enter your Aadhar number or Virtual ID and Name as per Aadhar Card and click the “Check” button.
PMAY Urban Apply Online Aadhaar Virtual ID Name
STEP 3: If your Aadhar number is correct, a new page will open which will look like the below image. If your Aadhar number is incorrect, try again by entering your correct Aadhar number. If you do not have Aadhar number, you will not be able to apply for PMAY.
PMAY Online Application Form | Source: pmaymis.gov.in
STEP 4: Fill the details correctly including your personal details, contact details, current residential address, Aadhar Number, Bank Account details and income details in the application form.
STEP 5: Click the checkbox which says “I am aware of….” and then click the “Save” Button at the end of application form.
PMAY Online Application Form Submit | Source: pmaymis.gov.in
STEP 6: Once you click “Save”, you will see a new screen where a system generated application number will be given to you, you can either print this directly if a printer is attached with your computer or save it for your future reference.
Your application is now complete. You can track status of PMAY application on the same website at pmaymis.gov.in.
PMAY Eligibility
Before applying for PM Awas Yojana online, please make sure that
– You are eligible to apply for the scheme (Check your name in the PMAY beneficiary list).
– You have your Aadhar Number with you, Aadhar is mandatory for PMAY online application.
– Your computer is connected to a reliable internet connection.
– You have the details of your saving bank account with you.
– You have the actual details of your household income.
Eligibility PM Awas Yojana
Take Printout of Online Application Form of PMAY
You can take a printout of the PMAY online application form filled by you by entering your name, father name & ID type or just the application number. Click the link below to take print out of PMAY application form.
https://pmaymis.gov.in/Open/Print_Application_By_applicationNo.aspx
The PMAY HFA Urban print assessment form page by application number will appear as shown below:-
PMAY Urban Online Application Form Print Name Mobile No.
People can also take printout of their PMAY Urban application form online through assessment ID which will appear as below:-
PMAY Urban Online Application Form Print Assessment ID
PMAY Online Application Edit/Change/Update
After submission of online application form on pmaymis.gov.in, you can also edit the details just by entering your application number and Aadhar number. The facility has been provided to the applicants in case they entered any detail incorrectly or wish to change their contact details.
PMAY Urban Apply Online Form Edit Update
To change or update the information of your PMAY application, please visit this link.
https://pmaymis.gov.in/Open/Format_A_B_Edit.aspx

title: हरियाणा सरकार ने छोटे व्यापारियों और दुकानदारों के लिए मुख्यमंत्री व्यापारी सामूहिक निजी दुर्घटना बीमा योजना और मुख्यमंत्री व्यापारी क्षतिपूर्ति बीमा योजना की शुरुआत करी, जानिये क्या ह इसके लाभ और पाएं पूरी जानकारीHaryana government has started Mukhyamantri Vyapari Samuhik Niji Durghatna Beema Yojana 2019. Under this scheme, govt. will provide an insurance cover of Rs. 5 lakh to registered small and medium traders. CM Manohar Lal Khattar has also started Mukhyamantri Vyapari Kshatipurti Beema Yojana. In this scheme, govt. will provide package ranging from Rs. 5 lakh to Rs. 25 lakh to traders, retailers, small shopkeepers & self employed persons on basis of their turnover.
full_text:
हरियाणा सरकार ने छोटे व्यापारियों और दुकानदारों के लिए मुख्यमंत्री व्यापारी सामूहिक निजी दुर्घटना बीमा योजना और मुख्यमंत्री व्यापारी क्षतिपूर्ति बीमा योजना की शुरुआत करी, जानिये क्या ह इसके लाभ और पाएं पूरी जानकारीHaryana government has started Mukhyamantri Vyapari Samuhik Niji Durghatna Beema Yojana 2019. Under this scheme, govt. will provide an insurance cover of Rs. 5 lakh to registered small and medium traders. CM Manohar Lal Khattar has also started Mukhyamantri Vyapari Kshatipurti Beema Yojana. In this scheme, govt. will provide package ranging from Rs. 5 lakh to Rs. 25 lakh to traders, retailers, small shopkeepers & self employed persons on basis of their turnover.
CM Manohar Lal said that Rs. 38 crore premium for both Mukhyamantri Vyapari Samuhik Niji Durghatna Bima Yojana & Mukhyamantri Vyapari Kshatipurti Beema Yojana would be paid by the Haryana government. CM has also made several other announcements for the welfare of different sections of society.
On this occasion, CM has also presented insurance certificates to six beneficiaries under this scheme.



(adsbygoogle=window.adsbygoogle||[]).push({});

Haryana CM Vyapari Samuhik Niji Durghatna Beema Yojana
Below are the important features and highlights of this scheme:-

This is an accident insurance scheme for traders, retailers, small shopkeepers, shop owners & self employed persons.
Under this scheme, govt. will provide Rs. 5 lakh insurance cover in case of any accident.
All the traders registered under Haryana Goods and Services Tax (HGST) Act 2017 would be covered under these schemes.
Around 3.75 lakh traders would be its beneficiaries.
The benefit of insurance would be admissible in case of accidental death, permanently disability and damage to two body organs, or eyes or one organ or one eye.

Haryana Mukhyamantri Vyapari Kshatipurti Beema Yojana
The important features and highlights of this scheme are as follows:-


(adsbygoogle=window.adsbygoogle||[]).push({});


An insurance cover of Rs. 5 lakh to Rs. 25 lakh would be provided to registered traders on the basis of their turnover.
This scheme will compensate loss of loss of their stock caused due to fire, theft, flood and earthquake and damage to furniture and other goods.
Around 3.13 lakh registered small and medium traders would be benefited under this scheme.
Insurance Cover & Turnover Limits –

Insurance cover of Rs. 5 lakh having annual turnover upto Rs. 20 lakh.
Rs. 10 lakh insurance coverage for turnover b/w Rs. 20 lakh to Rs. 50 lakh.
Rs. 15 lakh insurance cover for turnover b/w Rs. 50 lakh to Rs. 1 crore.
Insurance cover of Rs. 20 lakh for turnover b/w Rs. 1 crore to Rs. 1.5 crore.
Rs. 25 lakh for traders having turnover of more than Rs. 1.5 crore.



There are around 3,13,112 registered firms in the state in which number of registered traders are 3,86,669. All these traders can avail benefits of this CM Vyapari Kshatipurti Bima Yojana.





(adsbygoogle=window.adsbygoogle||[]).push({});

title: Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana – Gramin (PMAY-G) has finally been launched by the Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi in Agra on 20th November 2016. Under the PM Awas Yojana Gramin affordable housing scheme, central government aims to develop 3 Crore homes by the year 2022 in rural areas for poor families including BPL.
full_text:
Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana – Gramin (PMAY-G) has finally been launched by the Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi in Agra on 20th November 2016. Under the PM Awas Yojana Gramin affordable housing scheme, central government aims to develop 3 Crore homes by the year 2022 in rural areas for poor families including BPL.
PMAY-G is the revamped version of Indira Awas Yojana which was renamed earlier this year with some pro-poor changes in the scheme. Housing units under the PMAY-G scheme are already being offered to the beneficiaries in rural areas across the country. Pradhan Mantri Narendra Modi also handed over the allotment letters to the beneficiaries during the launch event.
The minimum area of home under the new scheme has been increased to 25 Square meter (267 Square foot) from 20 Sq.Mt. in earlier scheme.



(adsbygoogle=window.adsbygoogle||[]).push({});

Government has also released the scheme logo and a video

http://iay.nic.in/netiay/Video/PMAYGLaunch.mp4
The objective of the scheme is to provide homes to every Indian by the year 2022. Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana – Gramin will be implemented across the country except Delhi and Chandigarh. The immediate target of PMAY-G is to construct 1 Crore affordable homes in rural areas by the year 2018-19.


(adsbygoogle=window.adsbygoogle||[]).push({});

Financial Assistance Under PMAY-G
The central government would be providing a financial assistance of Rs. Rs. 120,000 in plain areas and Rs. 130,000 in eastern, hilly and IAP areas to the beneficiaries. Along with this, an additional Rs. 12000 will also be provided to build toilet to each beneficiary under the Swachch Bharat Mission. The beneficiaries will also be provided daily wages of up to 90-95 days (Rs. 18000) through MGNREGA.
Hence, the total financial assistance amount will be 1 Lakh 50 thousand for plain areas and 1 Lakh 60 thousand for eastern, hilly and IAP areas. Interested beneficiaries can also avail a loan of upto Rs. 70000 from any of the nationalized banks for the construction of home. 
Selection of beneficiaries under the Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana – Gramin will be done on the basis of SECC-2011 data. The government has also launched AwaasApp for beneficiaries to know the status of their application, funding or share the progress of construction.
To know more about the PMAY-G, please visit the following links
IN ENGLISH: https://sarkariyojana.com/pradhan-mantri-awas-yojana-gramin/
IN HINDI: Pradhan Mantri Gramin Awas Yojana in Hindi
OR visit the official website at http://iay.nic.in
Video & Image Source and Credits: http://iay.nic.in

title: Haryana government has started E-Kharid farmer registration & login process online at ekharid.in. Now all the farmers who wants to sell their crops can now easily make Haryana Ekharid Farmer Registration through online mode at the official website. Farmers are also advised to fill sowing details accurately and read the guidelines before filling E-kharid online application form.
full_text:
Haryana government has started E-Kharid farmer registration & login process online at ekharid.in. Now all the farmers who wants to sell their crops can now easily make Haryana Ekharid Farmer Registration through online mode at the official website. Farmers are also advised to fill sowing details accurately and read the guidelines before filling E-kharid online application form.
In case the farmers are facing problem in making Haryana E-Kharid Farmer Registration or Login, then they can contact toll free number (check below). Haryana State Agriculture Marketing (HSAM) Board has started this online process for registration of farmers in a hassle free manner.
All the farmers can now make ekharid registration online at official portal of Haryana govt. which is dedicated for procurement of crops from farmers.



(adsbygoogle=window.adsbygoogle||[]).push({});

Haryana E-Kharid Farmer Registration Form Online
Below is the complete procedure to make e-kharid registration of farmers through online mode:-

Farmers will have to firstly click athttps://ekharid.in/MMS/FarmerRegistrationOpen
Then the Ekharid Farmer Online Registration Form will appear as shown below:-
Haryana Ekharid Farmer Registration Form Online
Here all the farmers can enter their aadhar number, mobile number, personal details and upload ID proof details as well as recent photograph. Even the bank details of farmers as well as uploading of bank passbook is necessary to complete the E-Kharid online registration process.
Finally, farmers can click at the “Continue” button to complete the E-kharid farmers registration.
All the farmers can then make “Login” into their account at the official https://ekharid.in/ portal.

e-Kharid portal is an initiative of Haryana govt. to bring in transparency at all levels in the food grains procurement process. This portal will enable ease of doing business to the traders and will empower the farmers by providing real time information and timely payment. 


(adsbygoogle=window.adsbygoogle||[]).push({});

Guidelines for Farmers Registration at E-Kharid Portal
Below are the guidelines or process for registration of farmers at E-Kharid portal of Haryana:-

All fields marked with “asterisk (*)” are compulsory.
Farmers must possess their 12 digit unique bio-metric ID (Aadhaar Card number).
10 digit registered mobile number is mandatory. All the information will be send at this mobile number through SMS.
Date of Birth must match with your Identity proof.
Farmers can deposit scanned copy or photocopy of any 1 of documents – Aadhaar Card, Driving Licence, Passport, Voter ID card.
Farmer must have their recent passport size photograph.
For bank details, farmer must have the first page of bank passbook with them.
Farmers must enter their correct bank account number, name of account holder, IFSC code and upload necessary documents.

Moreover, farmers will have to enter the details of crop sown accurately. They must specify the name of scheme for which form is filled, area of land (in acres), crop name, place of sowing and category of farm produce to print acknowledgement receipt.
— For more details, contact the helpline number at 1800-180-2060 (9:00 AM to 7:00 PM) or send an email at [email protected] 





(adsbygoogle=window.adsbygoogle||[]).push({});

Content Source / Reference Link: https://ekharid.in/MMS/FarmerRegistrationOpen, https://ekharid.in/

title: Haryana government has announced Surcharge Waiver Scheme for electricity bills of tubewells on 3 September 2019. In addition to this, the state govt. also announced to provide relief of 9% to 45% to plot holders of Haryana Shehri Vikas Pradhikaran (HSVP) under the Enhancement Recalculation Scheme. This is the next major move after 3 settlement schemes for loanee farmers of cooperative banks.
full_text:
Haryana government has announced Surcharge Waiver Scheme for electricity bills of tubewells on 3 September 2019. In addition to this, the state govt. also announced to provide relief of 9% to 45% to plot holders of Haryana Shehri Vikas Pradhikaran (HSVP) under the Enhancement Recalculation Scheme. This is the next major move after 3 settlement schemes for loanee farmers of cooperative banks.
The state govt. decided to provide relief to tubewell consumers having electricity connections under Surcharge Waiver Scheme & plot holders of HSVP. There are around 6.10 lakh farmers in the Haryana state which have taken electricity connections for the tubewells. 
Out of these farmers, around 2.44 lakh connections have become defaulters and an amount of Rs. 147 crore is outstanding towards them.



(adsbygoogle=window.adsbygoogle||[]).push({});

Haryana Surcharge Waiver on Tubewells Electricity Bills
In this new Tubewell Surcharge Waiver Scheme in Haryana, if farmers wants to pay their electricity bills then no surcharge amount would be deducted. Previously, farmers had to pay surcharge amount of 20% to 25% of the power bills of tubewells. The surcharge amount would now be waived in case farmers make lump-sum payment of their bils upto 30 November 2019.
Moreover, Tubewells electricity connections of farmers which have been discontinued for less than 2 years on becoming defaulters would be restored. On Enhancement Recalculation Scheme, CM said that earlier plot holders does not gets information on enhancement by HSVP. Due to this, interest on the enhancement amount gets increased.


(adsbygoogle=window.adsbygoogle||[]).push({});

Previously in July 2018, a 1 time settlement plan with 40% rebate was launched for HSVP plot holders. Under that settlement plan, over 24,000 plot holders deposited around Rs. 853 crore as enhancement amount. In November 2019, another settlement scheme was launched with 37.5% rebate. In that scheme, over 4,000 plot holders paid an enhancement of Rs. 155 crore.
But till date, some plot holders have not paid their enhancement amount even in the previous 2 settlement schemes. The major demand of such plot holders was that the recalculation of enhancement must be done in their sectors. So, the state govt. has made new rules and a separate committee was constituted for recalculation. 
As per the recommendations of this committee, govt. has to perform recalculation of 300 sectors out of which calculation of 12 sectors has already been done. Now all the plot holders are required to deposit the enhancement amount as per this recalculation. As per the new rules, recalculation of each sector is going to be different. So, the plot holders are expected to get benefit ranging from 9% to 45%.





(adsbygoogle=window.adsbygoogle||[]).push({});

Content Source / Reference Link: https://www.livemint.com/news/india/haryana-waives-surcharge-on-electricity-bill-for-tubewells-1567523775055.html

title: Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar launched the Ude Desh Ke Aam Nagrik (UDAN) Regional Connectivity Scheme. This scheme will now allow the tourists to fly from Hisar to Chandigarh destination in just 45 minutes at price of Rs. 1,674. CM has boarded a 7 seated plane from Hissar to state capital Chandigarh. After completion of the expansion work in Integrated Aviation Hub in Hissar within 18 months, an 18 seater plane would start functioning.
full_text:
Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar launched the Ude Desh Ke Aam Nagrik (UDAN) Regional Connectivity Scheme. This scheme will now allow the tourists to fly from Hisar to Chandigarh destination in just 45 minutes at price of Rs. 1,674. CM has boarded a 7 seated plane from Hissar to state capital Chandigarh. After completion of the expansion work in Integrated Aviation Hub in Hissar within 18 months, an 18 seater plane would start functioning.
The launch of this flight is a part of the central govt. UDAN or Ude Desh Ka Har Nagrik Scheme aiming to build efficient regional air connectivity. Soon, the state govt. will start flights from Hisar to Jaipur, Delhi, Jammu and Dehradun.
The state govt. of Haryana will also setup the Air Shuttle Services and Flying Training Organisation at Hissar airport by SpiceJet. This would be done to provide training to at-least 100 cadet pilots per year in the initial phase.



(adsbygoogle=window.adsbygoogle||[]).push({});

Haryana UDAN Regional Connectivity Scheme 2019
Now people of Haryana can board plane from Hisar to Chandigarh and reach in 45 minutes at fare price of just Rs. 1,674. This is done under the Ude Desh Ke Aam Nagrik (UDAN) Scheme of the central govt. which aims to provide flights to common man at very less prices. This scheme will ensure that even a common man can board flight to reach destination.
Setting up of Air Shuttle Services and FTO at Hisar airport will provide training to 100 cadets in one year. Around 4 meritorious girls with state domicile will get 50% fee concession for entire training. Around 10% students with Haryana domicile to get 50% waiver on tuition fees.


(adsbygoogle=window.adsbygoogle||[]).push({});

SpiceJet is also committed to ensure absorption and placement of 70% pilot trainees. The Integrated Aviation Hub at Hisar is a mega project of the Haryana state government. This is being executed under the Civil Aviation Department in a phased manner. 

आज हिसार हवाई अड्डे पर एयर शटल सेवा एवं फ्लाइंग ट्रेनिंग ऑर्गेनाइजेशन (FTO) का उद्घाटन किया। #UDAN योजना के दिशा-निर्देशों के तहत क्षेत्रीय कनेक्टिविटी को बढ़ावा देने की एक पहल है। pic.twitter.com/KnoUDCiTPB
— Manohar Lal (@mlkhattar) September 3, 2019
 

आज हरियाणा सिविल एविएशन के लिए ऐतिहासिक दिन है। हमने गत वर्ष 15 अगस्त को इस एयरपोर्ट के टर्मिनल का उद्घाटन किया था। उसी दिन कहा था बहुत जल्द एयर शटल सेवा शुरू करेंगे। मैं स्पाइसजेट का आभारी हूँ कि इन्होंने क्षेत्रीय कनेक्टिविटी के नाते आज से एयर शटल को उड़ाने का निर्णय लिया है।
— Manohar Lal (@mlkhattar) September 3, 2019
 

हमारे आदरणीय प्रधानमन्त्री श्री @narendramodi जी ने एक बात कही थी कि हवाई यात्रा करने का सौभाग्य हवाई चप्पल पहनने वाले को भी मिलना चाहिए। #UDAN स्कीम के द्वारा सस्ती हवाई यात्रा सारे देश में लागू की गई, उसी योजना के अंतर्गत हिसार से चंडीगढ़ इस उड़ान का आरम्भ हो रहा है।
— Manohar Lal (@mlkhattar) September 3, 2019
 

आगे चलकर हिसार से दिल्ली, जयपुर, जम्मू, देहरादून, ये रूट खोलने की अनुमति मिल चुकी है और बहुत जल्दी हिसार के लोगों को इनका लाभ मिलेगा। स्पाइसजेट लिमिटेड द्वारा 100 कैडेट पायलटों के प्रशिक्षण के लिए फ्लाइंग ट्रेनिंग ऑर्गेनाइजेशन भी शुरू किया जा रहा है।
— Manohar Lal (@mlkhattar) September 3, 2019
 
Phase 1 has already been completed in a record time by establishing the first Directorate General of Civil Aviation-licensed aerodrome of the state and terminal building at Hisar airport.





(adsbygoogle=window.adsbygoogle||[]).push({});

title: Haryana government has started the process of making ration cards for all category people. These includes Above Poverty Line (APL), State Below Poverty Line (SBPL), Central Below Poverty Line (CBPL), Antyodaya Anna Yojana & other priority households. People can now apply online for Green, Yellow, Pink and Khakhi Ration Cards as per their category and can download forms for Mukhyamantri Parivar Pehchan Patra Yojana (Family Identity Certificate).
full_text:
Haryana government has started the process of making ration cards for all category people. These includes Above Poverty Line (APL), State Below Poverty Line (SBPL), Central Below Poverty Line (CBPL), Antyodaya Anna Yojana & other priority households. People can now apply online for Green, Yellow, Pink and Khakhi Ration Cards as per their category and can download forms for Mukhyamantri Parivar Pehchan Patra Yojana (Family Identity Certificate).
The new ration cards would be made in Haryana for around 83 lakh families covering around 10 crore of state’s population. Beneficiaries in BPL, AAY, OPH categories can avail benefits of subsidized rice, wheat, sugar from PDS or fair price shops located nearby.
Here we are providing you the complete information on how you can download APL, BPL, AAY & OPH ration card application forms.



(adsbygoogle=window.adsbygoogle||[]).push({});

Haryana Ration Card Form 2020 in 4 Colours – Details
The state govt. of Haryana has decided to make ration cards in Haryana in four different colours. This will enable govt. to identify beneficiaries easily and even the beneficiaries will not face any problem or confusion. You can check the category in which you fall in firstly before applying for new ration card:-


Category of Beneficiary
Colour of Ration Card


Above Poverty Line
Green (APL)


State Below Poverty Line (SBPL)
Yellow (BPL)


Central Below Poverty Line (CBPL)


Antyodaya Anna Yojana
Pink (AAY)


Other Priority Households
Khakhi (OPH)


Around 42 lakh ration cards will be made of people belonging to APL category while 24 lakh ration cards will be made for OPH category people. In addition to this, around 13.1 lakh ration cards of BPL category and 4 lakh ration cards of AAY category people would be made. The total number of ration cards to be made is around 83.1 lakh families in haryana.


(adsbygoogle=window.adsbygoogle||[]).push({});

Download APL / BPL Ration Card Apply Online Form to make ration card of your family. People can even apply online at saralharyana.gov.in (Antyodaya Saral Portal).All the SBPL and CBPL category people will get 5 Kg wheat per month at Rs. 2 Kg. AAY beneficiaries will get 35 kg wheat at Rs. 2 kg. 
BPL and AAY beneficiaries will also get 2 kg sugar at the rate of Rs 13.50 per kg, 7 liters kerosene at the rate of Rs 13.63 to Rs 14.58 per liter and 2.5 kg pulses at the rate of Rs 20 per kg per month. 





(adsbygoogle=window.adsbygoogle||[]).push({});

Content Source / Reference Link: https://www.hindustantimes.com/chandigarh/haryana-to-make-ration-cards-in-4-colours/story-yEtB1PPg0S58JHMqOIfH7H.html

title: हरयाणा युथ जॉब इंसेंटिव स्कीम के अंतर्गत अब हरियाणवी यूथ को नौकरी देने वाली इंडस्ट्री को 3 साल तक 3 हजार रूपए प्रति कर्मी प्रोत्साहन राशि देगी सरकारIn order to provide a major boost to the jobs for youths in private sector, Haryana govt. will start Youth Job Incentive Scheme 2019. Under this scheme, each industry which provides jobs to local unemployed youth will get incentives from state government. The assistance amount would be Rs. 3,000 per employed youth for the next 3 years.
full_text:
हरयाणा युथ जॉब इंसेंटिव स्कीम के अंतर्गत अब हरियाणवी यूथ को नौकरी देने वाली इंडस्ट्री को 3 साल तक 3 हजार रूपए प्रति कर्मी प्रोत्साहन राशि देगी सरकारIn order to provide a major boost to the jobs for youths in private sector, Haryana govt. will start Youth Job Incentive Scheme 2019. Under this scheme, each industry which provides jobs to local unemployed youth will get incentives from state government. The assistance amount would be Rs. 3,000 per employed youth for the next 3 years.
Just like govt. is focusing on raising the number of jobs in government (public) sector, Haryana Youth Job Incentive Scheme will focus on private sector. A large of employment opportunities would be created in industries or companies located in Haryana for local youth.
This scheme will encourage local companies to provide more and more jobs to unemployed candidates belonging to Haryana.



(adsbygoogle=window.adsbygoogle||[]).push({});

Haryana Youth Job Incentive Scheme 2019
The state govt. of Haryana wants that all big and medium industries (block A & B) would provide job opportunities to local youths. These companies will be given incentive of Rs. 3,000 for next 3 years on employment of local candidates. This scheme would encourage companies to firstly consider and explore the educational qualification and talent of local candidates. 
Similar type of scheme is already running in other states like Madhya Pradesh. However there would be no governmental pressure on any company to recruit local youths, this scheme is just for encouragement. The state govt. of Haryana is preparing a separate scheme for this purpose and will implement it soon. 


(adsbygoogle=window.adsbygoogle||[]).push({});

In Haryana, there are around 1.2 lakh small and micro enterprises, while the number of big and medium companies is 2415. The total export revenue of these companies is Rs. 89006.17 crore. The new scheme will primarily focus on all big and medium companies. 

हरियाणवी यूथ को नौकरी देगी इंडस्ट्री तो 3 साल तक 3 हजार रूपए प्रति कर्मी प्रोत्साहन देगी सरकार : CM pic.twitter.com/uzU9ULzvzR
— CMO Haryana (@cmohry) August 9, 2019
 
For the next 3 years, each company will get encouragement amount of Rs. 3000 per month. This means that a company would get Rs. 1,08,000 in the next 3 years for each local employee. The state govt. is also planning to provide other incentives to companies to encourage them to recruit more local youths.





(adsbygoogle=window.adsbygoogle||[]).push({});

Content Source / Reference Link: https://twitter.com/cmohry

title: बिजली बचत के लिए 5 स्टार रेटिंग पंप सेट किसानों को लगाने के लिए हरियाणा सरकार की योजना की शुरुआतHaryana government is going to start a new 5 Star Rated Pump Set Scheme for farmers in the state. Under this scheme, govt. will provide 5 Star rated pumps of water to kisaan at nominal prices. These pumps would be efficient and will reduce the loss of energy i.e helps in energy conservation. Here we are providing you the details of this water pumpset scheme of the state government.
full_text:
बिजली बचत के लिए 5 स्टार रेटिंग पंप सेट किसानों को लगाने के लिए हरियाणा सरकार की योजना की शुरुआतHaryana government is going to start a new 5 Star Rated Pump Set Scheme for farmers in the state. Under this scheme, govt. will provide 5 Star rated pumps of water to kisaan at nominal prices. These pumps would be efficient and will reduce the loss of energy i.e helps in energy conservation. Here we are providing you the details of this water pumpset scheme of the state government.
In order to realize the vision of Doubling of Farmers Income by 2022, the state govt. has come up with a new 5 Star Rated Water Pumpset Scheme. In this scheme, each farmer can get one pump set for installation in their farms / fields.
The complete details of the latest Haryana govt. water pump set scheme are described in the section below.



(adsbygoogle=window.adsbygoogle||[]).push({});

Haryana 5 Star Rated Pumps For Farmers to Save Energy
As we all know that water pump sets consume a large amount of energy to provide water to fields of farmers. So, the state govt. of Haryana has launched 5 star rated energy efficient pump set scheme for farmers. All the new tubewell applicants are herby informed that it is mandatory to install these 5 star rated pump sets.
Warranty & Details of 5 Star Rated Water Pump Set Scheme Haryana
The complete details of Haryana 5 Star Rated pumpset scheme are as follows:-


(adsbygoogle=window.adsbygoogle||[]).push({});


The state govt. of Haryana will start installation of 5 Star rated pumps in farmers fields to conserve energy.
Electricity Department of Haryana will procure these 5 star rated pumpsets for farmers.
All the farmers will get these 5 star rated pumps at nominal cost i.e the cost which they used to pay for earlier low energy conservation pumps.
All the pumps will come up with a free onsite guarantee / warranty period of 5 years.

Installation of energy-efficient 5-star rating pumps to promote energy conservation in Haryana. pic.twitter.com/z4OzLXpZHZ
— CMO Haryana (@cmohry) August 8, 2019
 

All the pumpsets to be provided to kisan under this scheme would promote energy conservation. 





(adsbygoogle=window.adsbygoogle||[]).push({});

title: हरियाणा सरकार ने पानी बचाओ अभियान के लिए मिस्ड कॉल मेम्बरशिप की शुरुआत कर दी है, 8222000200 नंबर पर मिस्ड कॉल देकर स्वयं को हरियाणा जल शक्ति अभियान में पंजीकृत करवाएंHaryana govt. has started registration for water conservation campaign namely Jal Shakti Abhiyan. Now people can give a missed call at 8222000200 to get Jal Shakti Abhiyan Membership. All the interested ones can apply for missed call membership for water conservation abhiyan. It is simple process to make Haryana Jal Shakti Abhiyan Registration through the mobile phones.
full_text:
हरियाणा सरकार ने पानी बचाओ अभियान के लिए मिस्ड कॉल मेम्बरशिप की शुरुआत कर दी है, 8222000200 नंबर पर मिस्ड कॉल देकर स्वयं को हरियाणा जल शक्ति अभियान में पंजीकृत करवाएंHaryana govt. has started registration for water conservation campaign namely Jal Shakti Abhiyan. Now people can give a missed call at 8222000200 to get Jal Shakti Abhiyan Membership. All the interested ones can apply for missed call membership for water conservation abhiyan. It is simple process to make Haryana Jal Shakti Abhiyan Registration through the mobile phones.
The targets of Haryana Jal Shakti Abhiyan 2019 will be set in a planned manner. These plans would be implemented for water storage, expansion of green area and awareness campaign in the cities. The state govt. will set responsibility of officers at municipal level and monitoring team will ensure smooth operation of process.
The state govt. of Haryana will also focus on rainwater harvesting arrangements and will ensure that these arrangements should be made in government buildings, public buildings, commercial-industrial buildings.



(adsbygoogle=window.adsbygoogle||[]).push({});

Haryana Jal Shakti Abhiyan Missed Call Membership
All the people can now join themselves in the water conservation campaign to “Save Water” for future generations. These efforts would ensure successful implementation of Har Ghar Nal Ka Jal Scheme. People can make registration by placing a missed call on the number 8222000200. 
Afterwards, people will get a message “Jal Shakti Abhiyan se judne kay liye apka swagat aur abhinandan.www.facebook.com/JalShaktiAbhiyanHR/ Your Membership No:JS*******Regards: Govt. Of Haryana” on their mobile phones.


(adsbygoogle=window.adsbygoogle||[]).push({});


मिस्ड कॉल मेम्बरशिप:
दिए गए नंबर पर मिस्ड कॉल देकर स्वयं को जल शक्ति अभियान में पंजीकृत करवाएं l#janshakti4jalshakti #everydropcounts #saverainwater #RainWaterHarvesting #Rainwater #SaveWater #misscall #boondboondsesagar #savetheplanet #savewater #JalHiJiwan #jalhijiwanhai pic.twitter.com/zPKR0fta4t
— Jal Shakti Abhiyan Haryana (@HaryanaJal) August 6, 2019
 
The state govt. is also working hard to remove encroachments on priority basis from reservoirs, ponds and lakes, and ensure digging of reservoirs by stopping the fall of dirty water in them. The govt. will ensure that wastewater of RO and the treated water in the sewerage treatment plant is used for horticulture as well as in the industries. 
All the parks and green belt areas would be prepared in greater number in various districts of Haryana. Now people can make Jal Shakti Abhiyan Registration by giving a missed call to the number mentioned above. 





(adsbygoogle=window.adsbygoogle||[]).push({});

title: हरियाणा के मुख्यमंत्री श्री मनोहर लाल खट्टर ने परिवार पहचान पत्र पोर्टल का शुभारम्भ कर दिया है, अब परिवार के मुखिया को भरना होगा ऑनलाइन आवेदन फॉर्म (संपूर्ण परिवार की जानकारी के साथ) या उसे अटल सेवा केंद्र या अंत्योदय सेवा केंद्र पर जमा करना होगा
full_text:
हरियाणा के मुख्यमंत्री श्री मनोहर लाल खट्टर ने परिवार पहचान पत्र पोर्टल का शुभारम्भ कर दिया है, अब परिवार के मुखिया को भरना होगा ऑनलाइन आवेदन फॉर्म (संपूर्ण परिवार की जानकारी के साथ) या उसे अटल सेवा केंद्र या अंत्योदय सेवा केंद्र पर जमा करना होगा

Table of Contents

Haryana Parivar Pehchan PatraParivar Pehchan Patra – Update Family DetailsApply Online for Parivar Pehchan PatraHaryana Parivar Pehchan Patra Application Form PDF DownloadHow to Apply for Parivar Pehchan PatraFeatures of Haryana Parivar Pehchan PatraParivar Pehchan Patra (Family ID Card) Scheme – HighlightsWhat is Parivar Pehchan Patra or Family ID CardParivar Pehchan Patra PortalHaryana Parivar Pehchan Patra – FAQ’s
meraparivar.haryana.gov.in Update Family Details | Haryana Pehchan Patra Update Family Details | Haryana Pehchan Patra Add New Member
Haryana Government has launched the Parivar Pehchan Patra (परिवार पहचान पत्र) Portal (meraparivar.haryana.gov.in) to provide unique identity to each family in the state. This portal will facilitate the offering of benefits of Haryana government schemes in a transparent and easy manner to people by using technology. Now all the people can apply online for Parivar Pehchan Patra (Family ID Card) in Haryana through this portal to get identity certificate.
The newly launched Parivar Pehchan Patra in Haryana would have the name of the head of family at the top. The name of other family members would be added in this identity certificate right after their birth.



(adsbygoogle=window.adsbygoogle||[]).push({});

On marriage of girls, her name would be transferred to Parivar Pehchan Patra of her in-laws. Three services namely disability pension scheme, old age samman allowance and widow pension scheme have been integrated on the Parivar Pehchan Patra (PPP) portal.
Haryana Parivar Pehchan Patra
To get Parivar Pehchan Patra (unique identity certificate) in Haryana, the head of the family will have to deposit a form. This Parivar Pehchan Patra Apply online form must contain the full details of the family with signature of head of family.


(adsbygoogle=window.adsbygoogle||[]).push({});

All the completed forms must be submitted at Atal Sewa Kendra or Antyodaya Sewa Kendra or Common Service centers, Tehsil Office.
Parivar Pehchan Patra – Update Family Details
You can also update the family details after you have received the Family ID card through the official portal at meraparivar.haryana.gov.in. Below is the complete procedure to update the family member details.
STEP 1: Go to the official Portal at meraparivar.haryana.gov.in.
STEP 2: Click on the Update Family Details Link or directly click here.
Update Family Details Link
STEP 3: In the next step, select “YES” if you have your 14 digit Family ID else select “NO” to enter your Aadhar number and proceed to next step.
Select YES or NO
Enter Family ID
Search With Aadhar
STEP 4: After your Aadhar / Family ID verification, you will be able to update the family details of Parivar Pehchan Patra.
The detailed procedure of updating the family details on Haryana Parivar Pehchan Patra Portal is given in the below PDF.
How to Update Family Details: https://meraparivar.haryana.gov.in/UM.pdf
Apply Online for Parivar Pehchan Patra
Though, the state government has launched the portal for online registration of Parivar Pehchan Patra but there is no procedure / link available for online application by the general public.
However, the applications by the general public for Parivar Pehchan Patra can be submitted at the Common Service Centers, Saral Kenrda and Tehsil Offices and then the operator will register the family on the portal. The operator will fill all the details of the family on the Parivar Pehchan Patra Portal and provide a unique Family ID after the successful registration / approval and verification.
The Family ID cards will be issued within few days after the successful registration.
At this portal, people can check how to apply online for disability, widow and old age pension schemes. Accordingly, operators at CSCs can then fill pension schemes application form online.
Haryana Parivar Pehchan Patra Application Form PDF Download
The application form of Haryana Parivar Pehchan Patra can also be downloaded in PDF format using the link given below.
Haryana Parivar Pehchan Patra Application Form
Download Parivar Pehchan Patra Form PDF: Download Now
How to Apply for Parivar Pehchan Patra
In order to apply for Haryana Parivar Pehchan Patra, follow the simple procedure given below.
To apply for Haryana Parivar Pehchan Patra, you will have to visit the any of the SDM office, Nearby Gas Agency, Block Office or Ration center and submit the dully filled application form.You can download the application form from the above given above and get its printout or obtain the new form hard-copy from the same center.Fill all the required information such as name, contact details, family member details, address, Aadhar number etc and submit the form at the same office.After the successful registration, you will be allotted a Unique 14 Digit Family ID and a smart card will will help in applying for the various government schemes of Haryana Govt.
Features of Haryana Parivar Pehchan Patra
Through the Parivar Pehchan Patra Scheme, the state government would be able to digitize the records of Haryana state resident families and keep track of them.About 56 Families residing in the state would be covered under the scheme. Out of those about 46 Lakh families are already covered in SECC-2011 list while the rest would be registered as new families.The scheme will help in increasing the transparency of government schemes, help reduce the corruption and eliminate the rising problem of duplicate Aadhar cards in the state.Family ID card has become mandatory for all government employees of the state, hence they will have to apply for the ID as soon as possible.
Parivar Pehchan Patra (Family ID Card) Scheme – Highlights
Below are some of the highlights of Haryana Family ID Card scheme
Name of SchemeParivar Pehchan Patra (परिवार पहचान पत्र)StateHaryanaLaunched ByChief Minister Shri Manohar Lal KhattarObjectiveTo bring in transparency to government services and keep track of Haryana State dwellersBeneficiariesAbout 56 Lakh families of HaryanaApplication FormDownload Application FormApplication ModeOfflineOfficial Portalmeraparivar.haryana.gov.inScheme Last DateNo Last DateDocuments RequiredAadhar CardParivar Pehchan Patra (परिवार पहचान पत्र) Highlights
What is Parivar Pehchan Patra or Family ID Card
The family ID Card or Parivar Pehchan Patra which will be given to each registered family would contain a unique Family ID along with few other details such as the name of head of the family.
The Family ID Card could be used to avail benefits of verious Haryana government welfare schemes such as Disability Pension Scheme, Old Age Samman Allowance, Widow & Destitute Women Pension Scheme among few others.
Parivar Pehchan Patra Portal
Parivar Pehchan Patra Portal (meraparivar.haryana.gov.in) is going to speed up the operation of 100% success in Mera Parivar – Meri Pehchan programme. Migrant families can upload their information on this portal after leaving the place so that their previous information could be removed.
There would be 3 digits for the village and 5 digits for family in Parivar Pehchan Patra. No individual digit will be there for the citizen. With this step, Haryana govt. is moving forward towards ensuring transparency in identifying the family and its uplift, mapping and providing benefits.
मुख्यमंत्री श्री @mlkhattar ने परिवार पहचान पत्र पोर्टल का शुभारंभ किया pic.twitter.com/Gu2BPGyjp4— CMO Haryana (@cmohry) July 26, 2019

हरियाणा में रहने वाले प्रत्येक परिवार को अब अलग से मिलेगा पहचान पत्र pic.twitter.com/oU6BdDr6di— CMO Haryana (@cmohry) April 28, 2020

Integration of Social Security Pension Schemes
CM Manohar Lal Khattar said that now the 3 social security pension schemes have been integrated at the official Parivar Pehchan Patra Portal. These schemes are Old Age Samman Allowance, Disability Pension Scheme and Widow pension scheme.
हरियाणा सरकार ने वृद्धावस्था सम्मान भत्ता (पेंशन) योजना, दिव्यांग पेंशन योजना और विधवा व निराश्रित महिला पेंशन योजना को परिवार पहचान पत्र पोर्टल के साथ एकीकरण किया है।इन योजनाओं को पीपीपी के साथ जोड़ने से लाभार्थियों को पेंशन जारी करने हेतु परिवार का विवरण आसानी से उपलब्ध होगा pic.twitter.com/jrwD26VRx0— CMO Haryana (@cmohry) June 25, 2020
Furthermore, the data of district wise families will be available to the Department, which other departments will be able to use for their preparing welfare schemes.
The state govt. of Haryana is working at war footing basis on making the Parivar Pehchan patra. This identity certificate would ensure automatic delivery of various citizen – centric services to people and will also curb corruption. Moreover, with the creation of database of all families, the benefits of social welfare schemes will reach the actual beneficiaries automatically and remove duplicity.
Haryana Parivar Pehchan Patra – FAQ’s



✔️ What is Haryana Parivar Pehchan Patra
Parivar Pehchan Patra or Family ID Card is a unique identification card containing 14 Digit number for each resident family of Haryana.



✔️ What is the Parivar Pehchan Patra portal
Parivar Pehchan Patra portal can be accessed at meraparivar.haryana.gov.in



✔️ How to Apply for Parivar Pehchan Patra
In Order to apply for Parivar Pehchan Patra, download the application form and submit this at Saral Centers / Block Office or Tehsil along with required documents.



✔️ How to Update Family Member Details of Parivar Pehchan Patra
You can update the family member details of Parivar Pehchan Patra at the official portal at meraparivar.haryana.gov.in



✔️ What is the benefit of Parivar Pehchan Patra
This Parivar Pehchan Patra will help in easy application for various government schemes and services



✔️ What is the last date of application
There is no last date of application for this scheme




Official Website – meraparivar.haryana.gov.in

Haryana Paudhagiri Campaign Student Login / RegistrationPaudhagiri Haryana Mobile App DownloadHaryana Paudhagiri Abhiyan – How to Earn Money / AwardsContact Us
Haryana govt. has started a green initiative namely Paudhagiri Campaign to encourage students to plant small trees. Now all the students can make Haryana Paudhagiri Campaign Login / Registration at paudhagiriharyana.in. There is a golden chance for students to plant saplings and earn money. All the selected students would get awards on nurturing the plants. Students can also download Paudhagiri Mobile App for registration and login purposes.
The state govt. of Haryana has launched Paudhagiri Abhiyan to tackle the rising global warming and climate change issues. To maintain a balance between nature and humans and to promote green revolution, govt. has started this Paudhagiri Campaign. 
In this campaign, govt. will distribute plant saplings to students and will encourage them for their proper nourishment.



(adsbygoogle=window.adsbygoogle||[]).push({});

Haryana Paudhagiri Campaign Login Students
Here candidates can enter their username and password to login for Paudhagiri Campaign in Haryana.

Candidates can also check the details of total plants geotagged, total plants distributed and plantation under process. Moreover, district wise plantation report is also available at the official Paudhagiri website.


(adsbygoogle=window.adsbygoogle||[]).push({});

title: हरियाणा सरकार अब पशु किसान क्रेडिट कार्ड स्कीम की करेगी शुरुआत, सभी किसान जिनके पास अपने पशु है वो आवेदन / पंजीकरण फॉर्म भर कर अप्लाई कर सकते हैं, जानिए पूरी जानकारी
full_text:
हरियाणा सरकार अब पशु किसान क्रेडिट कार्ड स्कीम की करेगी शुरुआत, सभी किसान जिनके पास अपने पशु है वो आवेदन / पंजीकरण फॉर्म भर कर अप्लाई कर सकते हैं, जानिए पूरी जानकारी

Table of Contents

Haryana Pashu Kisan Credit Card Scheme Application / Registration FormGet Loan Without Any InterestHow to Apply for Haryana Pashu Kisan Credit CardsHow to Get Loan under PKCC SchemeLoan DetailsHaryana Pashu Kisan Credit Card Repayment Schedule
Haryana govt. has launched Pashu Kisan Credit Card Scheme for all the farmers with livestock. With Pashu Kisan Credit Cards, farmers can get loans and buy anything they need but must repay the money within 1 year to avail concessional 4% interest rate. Check the procedure of how to apply and fill Pashu Kisan Credit Cards application / registration form.
The state govt. of Haryana has already brought a strict law for cow protection, now it would be the first in country to launch credit cards for farmers owning livestock. All the Pashu Kisan Credit Cards would be based on the lines of Kisan Credit Cards. The loan given under PKCC Scheme will promote animal husbandry as farmers will get loans for fish farming, poultry farming, sheep, goat, cow & buffalo rearing.
Around 10 lakh farmers to receive credit cards during FY 2019-2020 and the number of farmers availing credit cards would increase in the upcoming years. Here the complete details of Pashu Kisan Credit Card Scheme in Haryana.



(adsbygoogle=window.adsbygoogle||[]).push({});

Haryana Pashu Kisan Credit Card Scheme Application / Registration Form
All the farmers owning livestock would be eligible for Pashu Kisan Credit Scheme in Haryana. Farmers would be able to get credit of Rs. 76,300 per Murrah buffalo, Rs. 71,325 per exotic cow and Rs. 70,825 per indigenous cow. Moreover with these credit card, farmers can purchase anything and repayment period is 1 year to get concessional 4% interest rate. Otherwise, the interest rates will go up and farmers become defaulters too.
Get Loan Without Any Interest
Under this scheme, no interest will be charged on loans upto Rs. 1.6 lakh as mentioned above. The farmers will be given loans under Pashu Kisan Credit Card Scheme at 7% interest rate. Out of this, central govt. will provide 3% interest subsidy and Haryana state govt. will give rebate on remaining 4%. In this manner, the loan taken under PKCC Scheme will be without any interest. All the cattle rearers of Haryana can take advantage of Pashu Kisan Credit Card Yojana.


(adsbygoogle=window.adsbygoogle||[]).push({});

How to Apply for Haryana Pashu Kisan Credit Cards
Below is the complete procedure to fill application / registration form to apply for Pashu Kisan Credit Card in Haryana:-
The implementation strategy for Pashu Kisan Credit Cards in Haryana involves tie-ups with 24 dairy milk plants. These dairy milk plants have milk collection points along with chilling centres across the state.The data operators and the officials of the animal husbandry department will get the Pashu Kisan Credit Card application form of farmers filled at these milk collection centres.Next, the details of each dairy animal would be picked along with 1 photograph from the “Har Pashu Ka Gyan” app. This app had been used by the department of animal husbandry for livestock census.On completion of details, department will follow up with the banks so that Pashu Kisan Credit Cards are issued and delivered to farmers the next day at milk collection point itself.
Pashu Kisan Credit Cards in Haryana are going to empower farmers to provide the best nutrition such as area specific mineral mixture and also get mats and fans for the animals. This scheme is expected to become a game changer in Haryana. The farmers would be able to make repayment whenever they have the money and to enable them to use funds efficiently.
Alternate Method
To get Pashu Credit Card, go to your bank and apply for it. For this purpose, an application has to be submitted at the bank itself. Along with the Pashu Kisan Credit Card application form, documents like identity card, aadhaar card, passport size photograph will have to be submitted. It must be noted that this scheme is only for Haryana residents. After verifying the application form, your Pashu Credit Card will be sent in 1 month duration.
How to Get Loan under PKCC Scheme
In this scheme, farmers will have to give an affidavit to the Deputy Director of Animal Husbandry and Dairy department. Before this, farmer will also have to get his animal insured. For this, only Rs. 100 have to be paid.
Loan Details
Under this scheme, Haryana govt. gives loans of Rs. 40,783 to farmer who owns a cow. The loans will be given to farmers through credit card in 6 equal installments (Rs. 6,797 per installment) every month. Similar to this, loan of upto Rs. 60,249 will be given to the farmers having a buffalo. The money will have to be returned within 1 year with an interest of 4% per annum. The farmers who repay their loan on time will get extra benefit.
In case farmer takes loan above Rs. 1.6 lakh through Pashu Credit Card, then he will get loan at the normal interest rate. For this loan, farmer will have to something on mortgage. Here too, if farmer pays loan amount within one year, he will get rebate on interest.
Haryana Pashu Kisan Credit Card Repayment Schedule
One can easily understand the repayment schedule of Haryana Pashu Kisan Credit Card. For eg, if anyone buys diesel worth Rs. 4000 on 4 July 2019, then he must repay money by 3 July 2020. Similar to this, if anyone buys a fridge or pays tuition fees worth Rs. 9000 on 9 August 2019, then he must return that amount before 8 August 2020 to avail concessional 4% interest rate.
The main aim of these Pashu Kisan Credit Cards is to free farmers from the debt trap of money lenders and to boost their consumption expenditure. The state govt. of Haryana aims to issue 10 lakh Pashu Kisan Credit Cards in FY 2019-20. The new facility of Pashu Kisan Credit Cards would meet the short term credit requirements for rearing livestock as well as fish, shrimp and other aquatic organisms.
Similar to this, for brackish water shrimp, the rate is fixed at Rs. 92,800 while for freshwater shrimp, rate is fixed at Rs. 1.12 lakh. The state govt. has fixed this rate after including the feeding, labour, veterinary and electricity supply costs. Haryana govt. has approx. 89 lakh livestock and produces 44 lakh litres of milk per day. There are around 29 lakh farming households which depends on livestock for their daily income.

Department of Renewable Energy, Haryana is inviting online applications for the Solar Inverter Charger Subsidy Scheme 2020 at Antyodaya Saral Portal. Under this scheme, the state govt. will provide 40% subsidy on installation of solar inverters of 300 or 500 watt capacity. People can now apply online for Solar Inverter Charger Scheme at saralharyana.gov.in. 
This solar inverter charger system would ensure that battery bank of inverter is charged from solar urja during long power cuts. Under this Solar Inverter Charger Subsidy Scheme, govt. will provide Rs. 6,000 as subsidy on 300 watt and Rs. 10,000 as subsidy on 500 watt solar inverter chargers.
Solar inverters are capable of generating electricity from clean and green source of energy.

Afterwards, candidates can make “Login” using username & password. Then candidates can scroll over “Apply for Services” section and click at “View all Available Services” section. Next in the search box, type the ‘solar inverter’ keyword.
Then candidates can click at the “Application for Solar Inverter Chargers” under ‘Service Name’ section. Accordingly, the Solar Inverter Charger Application Form will appear as shown below:-

title: हरियाणा सरकार द्वारा किसानों का ऑनलाइन पंजीकरण अब कृषि एवं किसान कल्याण विभाग के पोर्टल www.jalhijiwan.ekharid.in पर, किसानों को धान की जगह अब मक्का, अरहर, सोयाबीन की फसल बोने पर मिलेगा अतिरिक्त लाभ, आवेदन की तारीख 27 May 2019 से 15 June 2019 तक
full_text:
हरियाणा सरकार द्वारा किसानों का ऑनलाइन पंजीकरण अब कृषि एवं किसान कल्याण विभाग के पोर्टल www.jalhijiwan.ekharid.in पर, किसानों को धान की जगह अब मक्का, अरहर, सोयाबीन की फसल बोने पर मिलेगा अतिरिक्त लाभ, आवेदन की तारीख 27 May 2019 से 15 June 2019 तक

Table of Contents

Districts to Produce Makka, Arhar Instead of Rice – 1st PhaseHaryana Farmer Registration for Maize, Arhar Crops Instead of RiceBenefits of Ekharid to Save Water – Jal Hi Jiwan Hai Haryana
As we all know that the production of Dhaan or Rice consumes a lots of water. Accordingly, lots of water gets wasted during cultivation of rice (धान). As per an estimate, in order to produce 1 kg of rice, approx. 3,000 to 5,000 litres of water gets consumed. To reduce water consumption and its wastage, the state govt. of Haryana is going to start a new scheme.
Under this new scheme, all the farmers would be encouraged to produce other crops namely maize (makka), arhar (pulses) instead of cultivation of rice (dhaan). In the first phase, the scheme would be implemented in 1 part of 7 major rice producing districts. In this pariyojana, around 50,000 hectares of land would be cultivated with crops like makka, arhar & others instead of rice.
Districts to Produce Makka, Arhar Instead of Rice – 1st Phase
The district wise part details where this scheme would be firstly implemented are listed here:- 



(adsbygoogle=window.adsbygoogle||[]).push({});



District Name
Block Name


Ambala
1st block


Yamunanagar
Radaur Municipality Town


Kurukshetra
Thanesar


Kaithal
Pundri


Karnal
Assandh


Sonipat
Ganaur


Jind
Narwana


Haryana Farmer Registration for Maize, Arhar Crops Instead of Rice
All the farmers can make their registration at the official www.jalhijiwan.ekharid.in portal launched by Agriculture and Farmers Welfare department. The starting date to make online registration is 27 May 2019 and the last date for registrations is 15 June 2019. 
On cultivation of maize and arhar pulses instead of dhaan, around 14,000 litres of water per hectare would be saved. As we all know, that the entire India is facing problem of acute shortage of water which is of serious concern. For more details, farmers can contact their nearest agriculture development officer. 


(adsbygoogle=window.adsbygoogle||[]).push({});

Benefits of Ekharid to Save Water – Jal Hi Jiwan Hai Haryana
The state govt. of Haryana has given assurance that the makka, arhar and other crops cultivated in place of rice crop would be procured by government agencies at minimum support prices. 

फसल विविधीकरण के प्रति किसानों का रुझान बढ़ाने के लिए अब मक्का, अरहर, सोयाबीन और अन्य फसलों के लिए भी न्यूनतम मूल्य निर्धारित करेगी सरकार pic.twitter.com/JuU4a707zM
— CMO Haryana (@cmohry) May 26, 2019

The state govt. will provide high quality seeds absolutely free. The cost of seeds which would be provided by the govt. costs around Rs. 1200 to Rs. 2000 per acre in open market. The state govt. will provide Rs. 2000 per acre as subsidy (financial assistance) to farmers. In addition to this, the premium amount of the Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana (PMFBY scheme) would be borne by the Haryana government.
